page.title: 09PEOPLE AND WORK
page.content: People and Work Blackhead Two farms are run by cornish families the rest by incomers.One man travels to work in London weekly.There are at least 10 retired couples. School age children go to Coverack Primary school or Mullion Comprehensive. The woodworker at Herons Pool came from Manchester.The Drawbar club manager and his family came from Scotland.Many incomers retire to Cornwall because they have enjoyed holidays but do not always like the winter winds. The family came to Chynhalls farm 35 years ago from Essex in a special train with all their implements and animals even the bees.An artist-potter has just bought Trevothen Farm to start an art and craft school.
